results.title: Gibraltar: Gateway to the Mediterranean
results.brief_description: The present political and economic situation in Gibraltar. Highlights historic events; emphasises the strategic importance ; its development as a naval base and the value of tis airstrip. Discusses the controversy with Spain. Shows familiar tourist attractions.

results.creator_credit: Walt Disney, United Artists Corporation and Burt Gillett
results.brief_description: Mickey tells a crowd of orphans a version of “Jack and the Beanstalk” in which he plays the leading role and takes on Rumplewatt, the “king of the giants - prince of the tyrants.”

results.title: Giant turtles
results.brief_description: Shows sea turtles coming ashore by night to lay their eggs before returning to the water. Also shows the hatching of the baby turtles two months later and their instinctive race for the water.

results.title: Giant molecules (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Demonstrates addition and condensation polymerization reactions, and indicates how physical properties and molecular shape of polymers may be related. Four polymers are shown, and the differences in their properties are explained using models. Finally, materials are shown being turned into the more familiar plastic consumer goods.

results.title: Giant in the sun
results.creator_credit: Victor M. Gover, Northern Nigeria Information Services and Sidney Samuelson
results.brief_description: This film discusses the land and people of northern Nigeria. It covers the ancient cities of Kano, Sokoto, Ilorin and Katsina, with the dazzling spectacle of the Sallah, presided over by the Emir. Shows traditional crafts flourishing alongside modern developments in industry, education, health and welfare. (Award: Grand Award at the Third African Film Festival, 1959).

results.title: Giant brains
results.creator_credit: Fiona Holmes, WGBH Productions and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The dream machine”.
This program traces the early development of the computer and introduces the pioneers who foresaw the universal application of these versatile machines capable of more than accurate calculations. Included is the work of Charles Babbage who invented the first computer in the 1800’s which mechanically compiled tables; Konrad Zuse’s use of electronic relays in the early 1930’s to represent information using the binary numbering system; John Mauchly and J. Presper Eckert who launched the ENIAC (Electronic Numeric Integrator and Computer) in the US in 1946 which used valves to carry out calculations; Freddie Williams who designed the first ‘Stored Programmed Computer’ using the Cathode Ray Tube to hold electronic information in 1949; the visionary work of Alan Turing who realised that computers could perform any logical task, on the basis of manipulating symbols according to rules, capable of simulating human thought.

results.title: Giant bears of Kodiak island
results.creator_credit: Wolfgang Bayer and National Geographic Society
results.brief_description: The great Kodiak bear is the largest carnivore to roam the Earth. Living on Alaska’s Kodiak Island, the bear roams the jagged coastlines and 4,000 foot mountains as part of their territory. This program captures the bears hunting, fishing, and teaching their young survival skills. As portions of the island become development targets, the contact between bear and human becomes more frequent. Compelling footage will have viewers spellbound.

results.title: Gianni Versace. Givenchy
results.creator_credit: Rebecca Reeder, Jessica Ramer, Lida Piompino, Adam Falk and Video Fashion
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Designers”.
This episode of “The Designers” series focuses on Gianni Versace and Hubert de Givenchy, two fashion designers who have had untold influence on fashion design in the twentieth century. Their designs affected not only the rich and famous who wore their creations but also the general public who were undoubtedly influenced by their sense of style. “Gianni Versace: Tragedy and Triumph” was made not long after Versace’s death in Miami. It includes interviews with Versace as well as comments from other designers, fashion industry people and celebrities who wore his clothes. The episode also looks at the retrospective exhibition of Versace’s creations at the New York Metropolitan Museum of Art, organised after Versace’s death by Donatella Versace and the museum. “Givenchy: Timeless Elegance” looks at Givenchy’s career which has spanned more than four decades. In particular it shows how the combination of Givenchy’s elegant designs and the charm of his muse/model Audrey Hepburn entranced the world. Includes interviews with Givenchy, Hepburn and fashion industry people as well as admirers of Givenchy’s clothes.

results.title: Ghosts of the civil dead [DVD] (D)
results.creator_credit: Evan English, Correctional Services, Outlaw Values and John Hillcoat
results.brief_description: Shattering experience set in an imaginary prison institution somewhere in the not too distant future. A crammed prison is the breeding ground for violence, drug trafficking and homosexual sadism. Authorities allow it all to breed in order to justify retaliatory crackdowns, in an escalating spiral of violence. The end product discharged from the institution is a new breed of social, disruptive misfits. Cast includes David Field, Mike Bishop, Chris DeRose, Kevin Mackey, Dave Mason, Nick Cave, Vincent Gil.
